title: Comedian Claims Clinton Begged Him To Release Tape Of Trump Making Racist Remarks
text:
Comedian Claims Clinton Begged Him To Release Tape Of Trump Making Racist Remarks "The weight of the free world is on your shoulders." by Andrew Kerr February 13, 2017 at 6:34pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Comedian Tom Arnold says Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton urged him just two days before the November election to release a damaging tape of President Donald Trump. 
Arnold claimed last year that he had “outtakes to The Apprentice where [Trump] says every bad thing ever, every offensive, racist thing ever,” including the N-word. 
He said the tape assembled various offensive clips for a “ Christmas video ” that was supposed to be “funny.” Advertisement - story continues below Federal Judge Rejects Tribes’ Move To Halt Construction Of Dakota Access Pipeline 
On Sunday night’s episode of I’m A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here , an Australian reality show, Arnold said Clinton “called me two days before the election and said, ‘Please release that,'” according to Australia’s Daily Telegraph . 
The comedian said the former secretary of state told him, “The weight of the free world is on your shoulders,” in an effort to entice him to release the tapes. 
Arnold, who said he considers Trump to be “kind of a joke,” claimed he declined to release the tapes out of respect for the editors and producers involved. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I’d love to be a hero, but I can’t hurt these families,” Arnold said he told Clinton. 
Arnold referred to The Apprentice ‘ s reported $5 million confidentiality agreement as the primary reason producers and editors connected to the tape were “scared” of releasing it. 
“Well, now, these people — two editors and an associate producer — are scared to death. They’re scared of his people, they’re scared they’ll never work again,” Arnold said during an interview. 
In a Monday morning interview on the Sydney radio show Fitzy and Wippa, Arnold said if nobody else was connected to the tape he would have released it already. Advertisement - story continues below
